Intervention: Participants received 4mg zoledronic acid by intravenous infusion (IV) q 4 weeks.
Participants received 4 mg zoledronic acid IV q 12 weeks and received placebo at Zometa IV at 4 week intervals between infusions of zoledronic acid q 12 weeks to keep them blind.
Eligibility: * Female patients 18 years of age. Breast cancer confirmed by bone metastases. Pre-treated with Zometa®, or Aredia (pamidronate) or all sequential regimens of both, for a minimum of 9 doses;

• Abnormal renal function determined by serum creatinine levels; current active dental problems, including: continuous infection of teeth or jaw bone; current exposed bones in the mouth; and current or anterior diagnosis of osteonecrosis in the jaw.
Recent (within 8 weeks) or planned dental or jaw surgery (e.g. extraction, implants).
• Diagnosis of metabolic bone disease other than osteoporosis (e.g. Paget bone disease).
Treatment with other experimental medicinal products within 30 days prior to randomisation.
Other exclusion criteria defined by the Protocol may have been applied.
Results: Proportion of patients with at least one skeleton event (ERS)
A ERS has been defined as a pathological fracture (vertebral and non-vertebral), spinal cord compression, bone radiation or bone surgery.
Title of arm/group: Zoledronic acid every (q) 4 weeks
Description of the arm/group: Participants received 4mg zoledronic acid by intravenous infusion (IV) q 4 weeks.
Unit of measure: percentage of participants 22
Title of arm/group: Zoledronic acid q 12 weeks
The participants received 4 mg zoledronic acid IV q 12 weeks and received placebo at Zometa IV at 4 week intervals between infusions of zoledronic acid q 12 weeks to maintain blindness.
Unit of measure: percentage of participants 23.2
